newsitem.title: FRANCE: In land of haute cuisine, French prefer quiche.
newsitem.headline: In land of haute cuisine, French prefer quiche.

text.p: In the land of "haute cuisine", a survey has shown that French people most like eating quiche, steak and chips, and stew.
An IPSOS opinion survey on Wednesday showed that 81 percent of French people like quiche lorraine "a lot", making it the most popular dish in France.

The quiche, a quick snack made from a pastry base with bacon, cheese, eggs and sour cream, edged out steak and chips and "pot-au-feu" (stew), favoured by 79 percent of 1,012 people interviewed by the monthly magazine Cuisine and Wines of France.
